plan.description: This layout maximizes open floor space by strictly adhering to a perimeter arrangement. All furniture is placed against the walls, creating a large, uncluttered central corridor that enhances the sense of spaciousness and provides clear circulation from the entrance. Zones are defined along the walls to maintain functionality without compromising the open feel.

furniture_placement.nightstand_1: Against the right (east) wall, on the top side of bed_1.
furniture_placement.nightstand_2: Against the right (east) wall, on the bottom side of bed_1.
furniture_placement.sofa_1: Against the left (west) wall, positioned in the lower half of the room.
furniture_placement.table_1: Against the left (west) wall, between the kitchenette area and sofa_1.
furniture_placement.chair_1: At table_1, pushed in towards the table.
furniture_placement.chair_2: At table_1, pushed in towards the table, next to chair_1.
furniture_placement.artwork_1: Mounted on the left (west) wall, centered above sofa_1.
furniture_placement.artwork_2: Mounted on the right (east) wall, vertically aligned with nightstand_2.
furniture_placement.plant_1: Placed in the corner where the right (east) wall meets the interior wall of the bathroom, next to nightstand_1.
furniture_placement.rug_1: On the floor against the bottom (south) wall, under the left window.
furniture_placement.rug_2: On the floor against the bottom (south) wall, under the right window.

plan.door_clearance: The central area of the room is kept entirely empty, creating a wide and direct path from the door into the space. No furniture is placed within a 3-foot radius of the door, ensuring it is completely unobstructed.

zone_arrangement.work_zone: The work zone is integrated into the living area along the upper-left (north-west) wall, adjacent to the kitchenette.
zone_arrangement.sleep_zone: The sleep zone is located along the entire right (east) wall, creating a dedicated and separate resting area.
zone_arrangement.living_zone: The living zone is situated along the left (west) wall, with the sofa providing a comfortable seating area opposite the sleep zone.
